payload.name: id
payload.description: Device ID (1-254). 0 and 255 are reserved.

payload.name: reserved
payload.description: reserved, value shall be zero

device_data.description: This message is used to communicate the current sonar state. If the data field is populated, the other fields indicate the sonar state when the data was captured. The time taken before the response to the command is sent depends on the difference between the last angle scanned and the new angle in the parameters as well as the number of samples and sample interval (range). To allow for the worst case reponse time the command timeout should be set to 4000 msec.

payload.name: mode
payload.description: Operating mode (1 for Ping360)

payload.name: gain_setting
payload.description: Analog gain setting

payload.name: angle
payload.description: Head angle

payload.name: transmit_duration
payload.description: Acoustic transmission duration (1~1000 us)

payload.name: sample_period
payload.description: Time interval between individual signal intensity samples in 25 ns increments (80 to 40000 == 2 to 1000 us)

payload.name: transmit_frequency
payload.description: Acoustic operating frequency (500~1000 kHz). It is only practical to use say 650 to 850 kHz due to the narrow bandwidth of the acoustic receiver.

payload.name: number_of_samples
payload.description: Number of samples per reflected signal (supported values: 200~1200)

payload.name: data
payload.description: An array of return strength measurements taken at regular intervals across the scan region. The first element is the closest measurement to the sensor, and the last element is the farthest measurement in the scanned range.

auto_device_data.description: **NEW (v1.1.0)** Extended version of `device_data` with `auto_transmit` information. The sensor emits this message when in `auto_transmit` mode.

payload.name: mode
payload.description: Operating mode (1 for Ping360)

payload.name: gain_setting
payload.description: Analog gain setting

payload.name: angle
payload.description: Head angle

payload.name: transmit_duration
payload.description: Acoustic transmission duration (1~1000 us)

payload.name: sample_period
payload.description: Time interval between individual signal intensity samples in 25 ns increments (80 to 40000 == 2 to 1000 us)

payload.name: transmit_frequency
payload.description: Acoustic operating frequency (500~1000 kHz). It is only practical to use say 650 to 850 kHz due to the narrow bandwidth of the acoustic receiver.

payload.name: start_angle
payload.description: Head angle to begin scan sector for autoscan (0~399 = 0~360 degrees).

payload.name: stop_angle
payload.description: Head angle to end scan sector for autoscan (0~399 = 0~360 degrees).

payload.name: num_steps
payload.description: Number of 0.9 degree motor steps between pings for auto scan (1~10 = 0.9~9.0 degrees)

payload.name: delay
payload.description: An additional delay between successive transmit pulses (0~100 ms). This may be necessary for some programs to avoid collisions on the RS485 USRT.

payload.name: number_of_samples
payload.description: Number of samples per reflected signal (supported values: 200~1200)

payload.name: data
payload.description: An array of return strength measurements taken at regular intervals across the scan region. The first element is the closest measurement to the sensor, and the last element is the farthest measurement in the scanned range.

reset.description: Reset the sonar. The bootloader may run depending on the selection according to the `bootloader` payload field. When the bootloader runs, the external LED flashes at 5Hz. If the bootloader is not contacted within 5 seconds, it will run the current program. If there is no program, then the bootloader will wait forever for a connection. Note that if you issue a reset then you will have to close all your open comm ports and go back to issuing either a discovery message for UDP or go through the break sequence for serial comms before you can talk to the sonar again.

payload.name: bootloader
payload.description: 0 = skip bootloader; 1 = run bootloader

payload.name: reserved
payload.description: reserved, value shall be zero

transducer.description: The transducer will apply the commanded settings. The sonar will reply with a `device_data` message. If the `transmit` field is 0, the sonar will not transmit after locating the transducer, and the `data` field in the `device_data` message reply will be empty. If the `transmit` field is 1, the sonar will make an acoustic transmission after locating the transducer, and the resulting data will be uploaded in the `data` field of the `device_data` message reply. To allow for the worst case response time the command timeout should be set to 4000 msec.

payload.name: mode
payload.description: Operating mode (1 for Ping360)

payload.name: gain_setting
payload.description: Analog gain setting

payload.name: angle
payload.description: Head angle

payload.name: transmit_duration
payload.description: Acoustic transmission duration (1~1000 us)

payload.name: sample_period
payload.description: Time interval between individual signal intensity samples in 25 ns increments (80 to 40000 == 2 to 1000 us)

payload.name: transmit_frequency
payload.description: Acoustic operating frequency (500~1000 kHz). It is only practical to use say 650 to 850 kHz due to the narrow bandwidth of the acoustic receiver.

payload.name: number_of_samples
payload.description: Number of samples per reflected signal (supported values: 200~1200)

payload.name: transmit
payload.description: 0 = do not transmit; 1 = transmit after the transducer has reached the specified angle

payload.name: reserved
payload.description: reserved, value shall be zero

auto_transmit.description: **NEW (v1.1.0)** Extended `transducer` message with auto-scan function. The sonar will automatically scan the region between `start_angle` and `end_angle` and send `auto_device_data` messages as soon as new data is available. Send a line break to stop scanning (and also begin the autobaudrate procedure). Alternatively, a `motor_off` message may be sent (but retries might be necessary on the half-duplex RS485 interface).

payload.name: mode
payload.description: Operating mode (1 for Ping360)

payload.name: gain_setting
payload.description: Analog gain setting

payload.name: transmit_duration
payload.description: Acoustic transmission duration (1~1000 us)

payload.name: sample_period
payload.description: Time interval between individual signal intensity samples in 25 ns increments (80 to 40000 == 2 to 1000 us)

payload.name: transmit_frequency
payload.description: Acoustic operating frequency (500~1000 kHz). It is only practical to use say 650 to 850 kHz due to the narrow bandwidth of the acoustic receiver.

payload.name: number_of_samples
payload.description: Number of samples per reflected signal (supported values: 200~1200)

payload.name: start_angle
payload.description: Head angle to begin scan sector for autoscan (0~399 = 0~360 degrees).

payload.name: stop_angle
payload.description: Head angle to end scan sector for autoscan (0~399 = 0~360 degrees).

payload.name: num_steps
payload.description: Number of 0.9 degree motor steps between pings for auto scan (1~10 = 0.9~9.0 degrees)

payload.name: delay
payload.description: An additional delay between successive transmit pulses (0~100 ms). This may be necessary for some programs to avoid collisions on the RS485 USRT.

motor_off.description: The sonar switches the current through the stepper motor windings off to save power. The sonar will send an ack message in response. The command timeout should be set to 50 msec. If the sonar is idle (not scanning) for more than 30 seconds then the motor current will automatically turn off. When the user sends any command that involves moving the transducer then the motor current is automatically re-enabled.
